text: {| |} BRP Jose Rizal (FF-150) is the lead ship of her class of guided missile frigates of the Philippine Navy. She is the first purpose-built frigate of the service, as its major warships were mostly transferred from other navies and reclassified as frigates. She is also one of the service's primary warships able to conduct multi-role operations such as coastal patrol and anti- submarine warfare. ==Construction and design== BRP Jose Rizal en route to Subic, Zambales BRP Jose Rizal (FF-150) participates in a tactical maneuvering drill with U.S. Coast Guard and U.S. Navy ships during exercise RIMPAC 2020 BRP Jose Rizal was designed and built by South Korean shipbuilder Hyundai Heavy Industries (HHI) and was based on the HDF-2600 Frigate Design, which in turn was derived from the of the Republic of Korea Navy (ROKN). Changes were made on the base design by making use of features found on newer frigates of the ROKN like the , considering reduced radar cross-section by having cleaner lines and smooth surface design, as well as reduced overhangs. It also features a low free-board design similar also to the of the Royal Thai Navy. It was assigned a temporary hull number P159 by Hyundai Heavy Industries. The steel cutting ceremony was held on 1 May 2018 in HHI's shipyard in Ulsan, South Korea while the keel laying ceremony was held on 16 October 2018. She was launched on 23 May 2019 and was delivered to the Philippine Navy on 23 May 2020. The commissioning was delayed after one of the ship's 65-crew tested positive for COVID-19 amidst the pandemic. She was eventually commissioned on 10 July 2020. ==See also== * * List of ships of the Philippine Navy == References == ==External links== Category:Frigates of the Philippine Navy Category:2019 ships Category:Naval ships involved in the COVID-19 pandemic
title: BRP Jose Rizal (FF-150)
